verses.text_plain: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.
verses.verse_html: 1After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.

verses.text_plain: And Job spake, and said,
verses.verse_html:
2And Job spake, and said, ▼
▼ spake: Heb. answered

verses.text_plain: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.
verses.verse_html: 3Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.

verses.text_plain: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.
verses.verse_html: 4Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.

verses.text_plain: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.
verses.verse_html:
5Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it. ▼
▼ stain: or, challenge
 , ▼
▼ let the…: or, let them terrify it, as those who have a bitter day

footnotes.body_text: ▼ let the…: or, let them terrify it, as those who have a bitter day
footnotes.body_html: ▼ let the…: or, let them terrify it, as those who have a bitter day

verses.text_plain: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.
verses.verse_html:
6As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months. ▼
▼ let it not be…: or, let it not rejoice among the days

tokens.text: upon it; let it not be joined

footnotes.body_text: ▼ let it not be…: or, let it not rejoice among the days
footnotes.body_html: ▼ let it not be…: or, let it not rejoice among the days

verses.text_plain: Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.
verses.verse_html: 7Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.

verses.text_plain: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.
verses.verse_html:
8Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning. ▼
▼ their…: or, leviathan

verses.text_plain: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day:
verses.verse_html:
9Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day: ▼
▼ the dawning…: Heb. the eyelids of the morning

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the dawning…: Heb. the eyelids of the morning
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the dawning…: Heb. the eyelids of the morning

verses.text_plain: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother’s womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.
verses.verse_html: 10Because it shut not up the doors of my mother’s womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.

verses.text_plain: Why died I not from the womb? why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?
verses.verse_html: 11Why died I not from the womb? why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?

verses.text_plain: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?
verses.verse_html: 12Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?

verses.text_plain: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,
verses.verse_html: 13For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,

tokens.text: For now should I have lain still
then had I been at rest

verses.text_plain: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;
verses.verse_html: 14With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;

verses.text_plain: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:
verses.verse_html: 15Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:

verses.text_plain: Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants which never saw light.
verses.verse_html: 16Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants which never saw light.

tokens.text: I had not been; as infants

verses.text_plain: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.
verses.verse_html:
17There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest. ▼
▼ weary: Heb. wearied in strength

footnotes.body_html: ▼ weary: Heb. wearied in strength

verses.text_plain: There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.
verses.verse_html: 18There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.

verses.text_plain: The small and great are there; and the servant is free from his master.
verses.verse_html: 19The small and great are there; and the servant is free from his master.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;
verses.verse_html: 20Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;

tokens.text: to him that is in misery

verses.text_plain: Which long for death, but it cometh not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures;
verses.verse_html:
21Which long for death, but it cometh not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures; ▼
▼ long: Heb. wait

tokens.text: for it more than for hid treasures

verses.text_plain: Which rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?
verses.verse_html: 22Which rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?

verses.text_plain: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?
verses.verse_html: 23Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?

verses.text_plain: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.
verses.verse_html:
24For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters. ▼
▼ I eat: Heb. my meat

footnotes.body_html: ▼ I eat: Heb. my meat

verses.text_plain: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.
verses.verse_html:
25For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me. ▼
▼ the thing…: Heb. I feared a fear, and it came upon me

tokens.text: For the thing which I greatly
upon me, and that which I was afraid

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the thing…: Heb. I feared a fear, and it came upon me
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the thing…: Heb. I feared a fear, and it came upon me

verses.text_plain: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.
verses.verse_html: 26I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.
